Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites Excellent Setting”
Reviews.Author: LawnRanger69
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in an excellent handicapped accessible room with adequate space for wheelchair and walker. The lack of a chair with the sofa was actually a great idea to provide the space. The staff at the front desk and both morning and evening meal were very friendly. The food was terrific as well as the beer on tap. The bed was extremely comfortable. The location on the north side also allows for a quick start going north on US75. We were very satisfied and will definitely stay here in the future as long as the handicapped accessible room is available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Cory W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week long business trip. Free breakfast and coffee every day. Flat screen tv's in the living room and bedroom. Staff was very friendly. Only thing missing in my opinion is a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “a good value”
Reviews.Author: tssammie
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay at this hotel and found it to be quite nice. Everything from the outside grounds to rooms were spotless. The staff was very pleasant and always wanted to make sure that we were very satisfied with everything. We will for sure stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Potential”
Reviews.Author: vestigium
Reviews.Content: We travelled over from the United Kingdom for Christmas. It seemed a natural choice with the Hilton's good reputation and an ideal location for travelling around the City. Regrettably, the two-bedroom suite we had booked was unavailable although two separate suites were offered which was acceptable. Further, the pool was out of action due to some technical problems. However, not to be too harsh as Christmas week is not a good time to recitify things that go wrong. The rooms were well equipped and presented to an excellent standard Would I stay there again? Yes, despite the niggles, staff made amends and were most friendly. The atmosphere was ambient and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: NHToni
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here 10/15/11-10/21/11 expecting a good experience(we had stayed at a Homewood suite in San Jose,CA the prior year. After reading the most recent reviews, I wonder if we stayed at the same place?? Yes, the front staff is knowledgable and helpful. The housekeeping staff is none of those. We had to ask every single day for something that housekeeping missed-towels,coffee,soap,toilet paper. I was treated rudely for every request. It would appear that the supervision of this staff is minimal. The breakfasts were marginal-even though I specifically asked if there would be a different menu each morning, there was not. It is frustrating when nothing offered is healthy-never any fresh fruit, only a few yogurts. Each meal had a high fat/cholesterol count and no one appeared to have any understanding of variety or healthy choices. I e-mailed the general manager after our stay with some observations(pool area not cleaned) etc and never even received an acknowledgment of the e-mail.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, good value”
Reviews.Author: FreedomTravel
Reviews.Content: Checkin was a breeze and we had reserved a big 2-bedroom suite which has a full living room and kitchen in between. Each bedroom has a door and a King sized bed along with a private bathroom. It really is easily a 2 couple or family room. We had 2 kids sleep on the pullout couch and it went fine. The front desk wasn't answering a few times when we called. The hot tub was barely luke warm but the pool was okay. No towels provided and there was a stack of used towels that had been ignored all day. Good value for the price we paid including breakfast and afternoon snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MullMoss
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Everyone I encountered, including the general manager, housekeepers, maintenance manager, and the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. I felt genuinely welcomed at this hotel. Each time I called or went up to the front desk, asking for a new room key, a wireless adapter for my laptop (I forgot my own), or a phone number for a cab service, the staff was friendly and efficient. I would be happy to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place :)”
Reviews.Author: arijithazra
Reviews.Content: It was a business trip(company sponsored) so I won't be talking about price here. Loved the room - very comfortable and clean. Room service was excellent in terms of making my room everyday. Breakfast was great with a whole lot of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience and I would prefer it anytime...”
Reviews.Author: adwaith
Reviews.Content: I had been there as a part of my business trip for more than 1 month.. It was a satisfying experience with pleasant and always helpful staff and soothing refreshments..They provide world class rooms with all facilities and soothing spa with pool and gymnasium with all basic amenities. I would prefer staying there next time I visit Dallas..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome long-stay hotel in Dallas..”
Reviews.Author: SumitSemwal
Reviews.Content: Amazing staff, wonderful breakfast, and efficient housekeeping. To top it up, the kitchenette is a boon for vegetarians and long-stay people. Parking is free, and there are quite a few decent eating joints outside, in case you don't feel like cooking.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1960
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a snap...no issues, and my room was waiting with a personal welcome letter from the manager, a bottle of water, and some cookies. The room was neat and very clean...including the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable with a variety of different type pillows to choose from. On Mondays-Thursday evenings, there is a free managers welcome with sodas, water, juices, beer, and wine. Along with themed food offerings...a mini-buffet. The food was great. Also, they have a full, serve-yourself breakfast daily...cereals, beads, waffles, eggs, bacon, bisquits and gravy, fruit, etc... These are all part of their regular service. What a deal!!! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal; Not a great location”
Reviews.Author: Bangback
Reviews.Content: I stay at quite a few Homewood Suites since my corporate rate is really competitive and I like having a fridge, microwave, and separate bedroom. While labelled park central, this is not near any of the hotels I associate with park central. In fact, a short drive around indicates a wide range of low-end strip malls, ethnic fast food, and similar. The clientele is definitely not upscale business. I did not see any white collar business travellers there. Mainly construction, families, travelling tradespeople. I would not stay here as a solo woman due to the neighborhood, sketchy parking lot, and many external entrances. I presume the ones without card keys are locked at night. Really nice pool/hot tub area with great hours until midnight. Dinner was OK (typical for Homewood) though very poorly attended. Hotel mechanicals (air conditioning, ice machine) were noisy. Room was clean with nice LCD TVs unlike most older Homewoods. Bedding very comfortable. Service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff; OK Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Brino99
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property twice in the last three weeks. I noticed the last TripAdvisor review was 10 months ago, so I thought I would add my 2 cents. I used the title about the friendly staff because that is one of the things I like about this property. I have probably encountered about 5 of the front desk staff both in person and over the phone and I found them all to be extermely engaging and friendly. Alot of the reviews on this web site address the front desk staff, so obviously that is important with travelers. My luck so far with the folks at Homewodd Suites by Hilton Dallas-Park Central Area has been excellent. I quickly read a couple of reviews on this hotel and would like to address a couple of things. First of all, there is not a Manager's Reception every night. Like most Homewood Suites, it is Monday - Thursday. As another reviewer noted, the property is a little dated. I would say the furniture is somewhere in between old and new. Hope that makes sense. The TV in the living area appears to be circa 2000-2001 and the TV in the bedroom is a little older, so I am guessing the furniture is probably from the mid '90's. Bottom line, the room we had was comfortable (had the same room both weekends we were there). If you are looking for new furniture and flat screen TV's, this isn't your place. The neighborhood where this hotel is located is kind of interesting. It is only a couple of blocks off I-635 and a mile or so east of I-75. There are a number of nearby hotels, but for some reason, the location seems odd to me. Can't quite pinpoint what it is. However, there are a number of nearby restaurants including Cheddar's, Outback, Red Lobster and Olive Garden. We went to Cheddar's our last visit and it was great as always. One of the reasons I choose this property was because of the price. We paid $87.00/night including tax. It is the least expensive Homewood Suites in the Dallas area. Both weekends we were there, they didn't seem to be too busy. We would leave and come back to our same parking place. I would attribute the lack of business to the economy and the aforementioned odd location. All that said, I would highly recommend staying here if you are looking for a decent room at a decent price that includes a complimentary breakfast. We just got back from staying at a Homewood Suites in Orlando and their breakfast set-up was a little more sophisticated (milk dispensers vs. milk in a pitcher sitting in melting water), but it is decent for a free breakfast. The first time we were there they had some excellent bacon which surprised me because you usually don't find that in a free breakfast. However, the next week, they had sausage links that tasted like what I would have expected. One last note...we have been staying here while going to the Cowboys games and it is convenient to hop on I-635 West to head to the game. It only takes about 20 minutes to get to the stadium in Arlington.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: d33j
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the Thanksgiving weekend. The $80 rate was a great value for a suite room with a king bed and a kitchen. The TV in the living room also had a VCR. The room was quiet, spacious and clean. A Kroger is less than half a mile away, and the hotel is next to a Racetrak gas station so it was easy to fill up with cheap gas. On the website, we asked for a room on a high floor, which we received. The rate includes a hot breakfast with bacon, eggs, potatoes, waffles, oatmeal, etc. and a happy hour every day. The hotel has an indoor pool, business center and fitness room. Unlike other hotels, wireless internet access was included without an extra fee. Parking was ample and free. When we asked to stay an extra night, the manager gave us the same $80 rate. Last year we stayed at the Doubletree Campbell Center whose glass walls transmitted all the cold air into the room and whose walls were paper thin. I was aghast the Doubletree Campbell Center received a high rating on TripAdvisor. We have had good experiences with the Doubletree chain, but not the one at Campbell Center. We will stay at the Homewood Suites instead of the Doubletree Campbell Center and save 50%! We have also stayed at the Fairfield Inn next door to the Homewood Suites Park Central, but the latter has a kitchen so it is a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: sarah-louise
Reviews.Content: After staying at Homewood Suites in Houston I thought this would be of a similar standard - I was wrong. Although everything is clean and fresh everything is really dated, from the lounge to all the units in the kitchen area. It's not in a wonderful position either, our room was on the ground floor overlooking an office car park. I wouldn't rush to stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Dallas - Park Central Area
HotelInfo.Address: 9169 Markville Drive, Dallas, TX 75243
